info.title: Shopware Store API
info.description: This endpoint reference contains an overview of all endpoints comprising the Shopware Store API

links.description: Link members related to the primary data.

included.description: To reduce the number of HTTP requests, servers **MAY** allow responses that include related resources along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents".

meta.description: Non-standard meta-information that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

data.description: The document's "primary data" is a representation of the resource or collection of resources targeted by a request.

oneOf.description: An array of resource objects, an array of resource identifier objects, or an empty array ([]), for requests that target resource collections.

resource.description: "Resource objects" appear in a JSON API document to represent resources.

relationshipLinks.description: A resource object **MAY** contain references to other resource objects ("relationships"). Relationships may be to-one or to-many. Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

allOf.description: A `self` member, whose value is a URL for the relationship itself (a "relationship URL"). This URL allows the client to directly manipulate the relationship. For example, it would allow a client to remove an `author` from an `article` without deleting the people resource itself.

link.description: A link **MUST** be represented as either: a string containing the link's URL or a link object.

oneOf.description: A string containing the link's URL.

href.description: A string containing the link's URL.

attributes.description: Members of the attributes object ("attributes") represent information about the resource object in which it's defined.

relationships.description: Members of the relationships object ("relationships") represent references from the resource object in which it's defined to other resource objects.

allOf.description: References to other resource objects in a to-one ("relationship"). Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

relationshipToMany.description: An array of objects each containing \"type\" and \"id\" members for to-many relationships.

jsonapi.description: An object describing the server's implementation

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem. It **SHOULD NOT** change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

description.description: A human-readable description of the problem.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/title" for a specific attribute].

parameter.description: A string indicating which query parameter caused the error.

cmsPageIdSwitched.description: Runtime field, cannot be used as part of the criteria.

field.description: The field you want to aggregate over.

AggregationRange.title: AggregationRange
AggregationRange.description: For more information, see [Aggregations Reference > Range Aggregation](https://developer.shopware.com/docs/resources/references/core-reference/dal-reference/aggregations-reference.html#range-aggregations)

name.description: Give your aggregation an identifier, so you can find it easier

field.description: The field you want to aggregate over.

from.description: The lower bound of the range

to.description: The upper bound of the range

from.description: The lower bound of the range

to.description: The upper bound of the range

CalculatedPrice.description: Represents a product along with detailed information required to display a variant selection.

taxRules.description: Currently active tax rules and/or rates

name.description: Name of the cart - for example `guest-cart`

token.description: Context token identifying the cart and the user session

errors.description: A list of all cart errors, such as insufficient stocks, invalid addresses or vouchers.

transactions.description: A list of all payment transactions associated with the current cart.

customerComment.description: A comment that can be added to the cart.

CartDelivery.description: A list of all cart errors, such as insufficient stocks, invalid addresses or vouchers.

CartDeliveryPosition.description: A list of all cart errors, such as insufficient stocks, invalid addresses or vouchers.

CartError.description: A list of all cart errors, such as insufficient stocks, invalid addresses or vouchers.

Criteria.description: Search parameters. For more information, see our documentation on [Search Queries](https://shopware.stoplight.io/docs/store-api/docs/concepts/search-queries.md#structure)

limit.description: Number of items per result page

filter.description: List of filters to restrict the search result. For more information, see [Search Queries > Filter](https://shopware.stoplight.io/docs/store-api/docs/concepts/search-queries.md#filter)

ids.description: List of ids to search for

query.description: List of queries to restrict the search result. For more information, see [Search Queries > Query](https://shopware.stoplight.io/docs/store-api/docs/concepts/search-queries.md#query)

associations.description: Associations to include. For more information, see [Search Queries > Associations](https://shopware.stoplight.io/docs/store-api/cf710bf73d0cd-search-queries#associations)

post-filter.description: Filters that applied without affecting aggregations. For more information, see [Search Queries > Post Filter](https://shopware.stoplight.io/docs/store-api/docs/concepts/search-queries.md#post-filter)

fields.description: Fields which should be returned in the search result.

TotalCountMode.description: Whether the total for the total number of hits should be determined for the search query. none = disabled total count, exact = calculate exact total amount (slow), next-pages = calculate only for next page (fast)

total.description: The total number of found entities

aggregations.description: Contains aggregated data. A simple example is the determination of the average price from a product search query.

page.description: The actual page. This can be used for pagination.

limit.description: The actual limit. This is used for pagination and goes together with the page.

taxRules.description: Currently active tax rules and/or rates

paymentChangeable.description: The key-value pairs contain the uuid of the order as key and a boolean as value, indicating that the payment method can still be changed.

ProductDetailResponse.description: Represents a product along with detailed information required to display a variant selection.

configurator.description: List of property groups with their corresponding options and information on how to display them.

allOf.description: Additional search parameters for product listings

order.description: Specifies the sorting of the products by `availableSortings`. If not set, the default sorting will be set according to the shop settings. The available sorting options are sent within the response under the `availableSortings` key. In order to sort by a field, consider using the `sort` parameter from the listing criteria. Do not use both parameters together, as it might lead to unexpected results.

limit.description: Number of items per result page. If not set, the limit will be set according to the default products per page, defined in the system settings.

manufacturer.description: Filter by manufacturers. List of manufacturer identifiers separated by a `|`.

min-price.description: Filters by a minimum product price. Has to be lower than the `max-price` filter.

max-price.description: Filters by a maximum product price. Has to be higher than the `min-price` filter.

rating.description: Filter products with a minimum average rating.

shipping-free.description: Filters products that are marked as shipping-free.

properties.description: Filters products by their properties. List of property identifiers separated by a `|`.

manufacturer-filter.description: Enables/disabled filtering by manufacturer. If set to false, the `manufacturer` filter will be ignored. Also the `aggregations[manufacturer]` key will be removed from the response.

price-filter.description: Enables/disabled filtering by price. If set to false, the `min-price` and `max-price` filter will be ignored. Also the `aggregations[price]` key will be removed from the response.

rating-filter.description: Enables/disabled filtering by rating. If set to false, the `rating` filter will be ignored. Also the `aggregations[rating]` key will be removed from the response.

shipping-free-filter.description: Enables/disabled filtering by shipping-free products. If set to false, the `shipping-free` filter will be ignored. Also the `aggregations[shipping-free]` key will be removed from the response.

property-filter.description: Enables/disabled filtering by properties products. If set to false, the `properties` filter will be ignored. Also the `aggregations[properties]` key will be removed from the response.

property-whitelist.description: A whitelist of property identifiers which can be used for filtering. List of property identifiers separated by a `|`. The `property-filter` must be `true`, otherwise the whitelist has no effect.

reduce-aggregations.description: By sending the parameter `reduce-aggregations` , the post-filters that were applied by the customer, are also applied to the aggregations. This has the consequence that only values are returned in the aggregations that would lead to further filter results. This parameter is a flag, the value has no effect.

no-aggregations.description: Resets all aggregations in the criteria. This parameter is a flag, the value has no effect.

only-aggregations.description: If this flag is set, no products are fetched. Sorting and associations are also ignored. This parameter is a flag, the value has no effect.

currentFilters.description: Contains the state of the filters. These can be used to create listing filters.

availableSortings.description: Contains the available sorting. These can be used to show a sorting select-box in the product listing.

currentCustomerGroup.description: Customer group of the current user

fallbackCustomerGroup.description: Fallback group if the default customer group is not applicable

salesChannel.description: Information about the current sales channel

taxRules.description: Currently active tax rules and/or rates

context.description: Core context with general configuration values and state

pageId.description: The id of the current dynamic page

type.description: The type of the current dynamic page

position.description: The position of the dynamic page in the list of dynamic pages

apiAlias.description: The API alias of the appointment basic setting

canSendRequestEmail.description: Indicates if request emails can be sent

canBookAppointment.description: Indicates if appointments can be booked

salesChannelName.description: The name of the sales channel

accessibleFrom.description: The time the client can access the appointment

accessibleTo.description: The time the appointment will be closed, the client can not access

answer.description: The invitation status that client responded to

CreateAppointmentRequestBody.description: Includes all data you will need to attend to a appointment.

firstName.description: The first name of the requester

lastName.description: The last name of the requester

emailAddress.description: The email address of the requester

companyName.description: The company name of the requester

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the requester

triggeredAt.description: The time when the interaction was triggered

lifeTimeInSeconds.description: The time in seconds how long the interaction should be stored in the database

pageId.description: The id of the page that was closed

page.description: Current page position in the pagination

productId.description: the id from the product which is shown on the dynamic page

anyOf.description: the id from the product which is used in the interaction

JoinAppointmentResponse.description: Includes all data you will need to attend to a appointment.

mercureSubscriberTopics.description: The topics to which the attendee/guide can subscribe for

mercurePublisherTopic.description: The topic to which the attendee/guide can send updates

JWTMercureSubscriberToken.description: The JWT mercure token to publish updates

mercureHubPublicUrl.description: The mercure hub url to connect for subscribing and updating

JWTMercurePublisherToken.description: The JWT mercure token to subscribe for updates

newContextToken.description: The new context token will be used in the header (sw-context-token) for calling the other routes

attendeeId.description: The created Id for the attendee

salesChannelId.description: The id of the current sales channel

salesChannelName.description: The name of the current sales channel

isPreview.description: To see if it's a preview appointment

example.JWTMercureSubscriberToken: jwt token for subscribing to updates
example.newContextToken: new context token to call the other routes

pageId.description: the id from the page which was viewed

sectionId.description: the id from the section within the page which was viewed

slideAlias.description: the alias of the slide which was viewed

oneOf.description: the number of the page which was viewed
A product result contains product information and product variant/configuration information. It corresponds with presentation product page
A category result contains category information. It corresponds with a presentation category page
A landing page result contains no specific fields.

navigation.groupName: Default Digital Sales Rooms product detail page

productId.description: the id from the product which is used in the interaction

active.description: Whether the screen sharing is active or not
Status if the mode is toggled to active or inactive

videoUserId.description: Id of the attendee in the video chat tool

guideCartPermissionsGranted.description: The permission for guide cart actions

errors.title: Bad Request
errors.description: Bad parameters for this endpoint. See documentation for the correct ones.

errors.title: Bad Request
errors.description: Bad parameters for this endpoint. See documentation for the correct ones.

errors.title: Unauthorized
errors.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

errors.title: Unauthorized
errors.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

errors.title: Forbidden
errors.description: This operation is restricted to logged in users.

errors.title: Forbidden
errors.description: This operation is restricted to logged in users.

errors.title: Not Found
errors.description: Resource with given parameter was not found.

errors.title: Not Found
errors.description: Resource with given parameter was not found.

ContextTokenResponse.description: Returns the context token. Use that as your `sw-context-token` header for subsequent requests. Redirect if getRedirectUrl is set.

redirectUrl.description: Define the URL which browser will be redirected to

OpenApi3.description: Returns information about the store API.

ApiKey.description: Identifies the sales channel you want to access the API through
ApiKey.name: sw-access-key

ContextToken.description: Identifies an anonymous or identified user session
ContextToken.name: sw-context-token

post.description: Perform a filtered search for newsletter recipients.
Make changes to a customer's account, like changing their name, salutation or title.

salutationId.description: Id of the salutation for the customer account. Fetch options using `salutation` endpoint.

firstName.description: Customer first name. Value will be reused for shipping and billing address if not provided explicitly.

lastName.description: Customer last name. Value will be reused for shipping and billing address if not provided explicitly.

company.description: Company of the customer. Only required when `accountType` is `business`.

200.description: Returns a success response indicating a successful update

post.description: Changes a customer's email address to a new email address, using their current password as a validation.

email.description: New email address. Has to be unique amongst all customers

emailConfirmation.description: Confirmation of the new email address.

200.description: Returns a success response indicating a successful update

post.description: Changes the language of the logged in customer

200.description: Returns a success response indicating a successful update

post.description: Changes a customer's password using their current password as a validation.

200.description: Returns a success response indicating a successful update.

post.summary: Change the customer's default payment method
post.description: Changes a customer's default (preselected) payment method.

parameters.name: paymentMethodId
parameters.description: Identifier of the desired default payment method

200.description: Returns a success response indicating a successful update.

post.summary: Checks if the customer recovery entry for a given hash is expired.
post.description: This can be used to validate a provided hash has a valid and not expired customer recovery hash.

hash.description: Parameter from the link in the confirmation mail sent in Step 1

200.description: Returns a CustomerRecoveryIsExpiredResponse that indicates if the hash is expired or not.

post.description: Returns information about the current customer.

200.description: Returns the logged in customer, also for guest sessions. Check for the value of `guest` field to see whether the customer is a guest.

delete.description: Deletes a customer profile along with their addresses, wishlists and associated data. Created orders and their payment/shipping information (addresses) and reviews are not deleted.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating a successful removal of the customer profile

delete.summary: Delete an address of a customer
delete.description:
Delete an address of customer.

    Only addresses which are not set as default addresses for shipping or billing can be deleted. You can check the current default addresses of your customer using the profile information endpoint and change them using the default address endpoint.

    **A customer must have at least one address (which can be used for shipping and billing).**

    An automatic fallback is not applied.

parameters.name: addressId
parameters.description: ID of the address to be deleted.

204.description: No Content response, when the address has been deleted

400.description: Response containing a list of errors, most likely due to the address being in use

patch.summary: Modify an address of a customer
patch.description: Modifies an existing address of a customer.

parameters.name: addressId
parameters.description: Address ID

post.description: Lists all addresses of the current customer and allows filtering them based on a criteria.
Logs in customers given their credentials.

401.description: If credentials are incorrect an error is returned

post.summary: Imitate the log in as a customer
post.description: Imitate the log in as a customer given a generated token.

userId.description: ID of the user who generated the token

400.description: If the token is incorrect an error is returned

post.description: Logs out a customer.

Confirms a customer registration when double opt-in is activated.

Learn more about double opt-in registration in our guide "Register a customer".

em.description: Email hash from the email received

200.description: Returns the logged in customer. The customer is automatically logged in with the `sw-context-token` header provided, which can be reused for subsequent requests.

412.description: The customer has already been confirmed

post.description: Registers a customer. Used both for normal customers and guest customers.See the Guide "Register a customer" for more information on customer registration.

email.description: Email of the customer. Has to be unique, unless `guest` is `true`

password.description: Password for the customer. Required, unless `guest` is `true`

salutationId.description: Id of the salutation for the customer account. Fetch options using `salutation` endpoint.

firstName.description: Customer first name. Value will be reused for shipping and billing address if not provided explicitly.

lastName.description: Customer last name. Value will be reused for shipping and billing address if not provided explicitly.

storefrontUrl.description: URL of the storefront for that registration. Used in confirmation emails. Has to be one of the configured domains of the sales channel.

accountType.description: Account type of the customer which can be either `private` or `business`.

guest.description: If set, will create a guest customer. Guest customers can re-use an email address and don't need a password.

affiliateCode.description: Field can be used to store an affiliate tracking code

campaignCode.description: Field can be used to store a campaign tracking code

post.summary: Reset a password with recovery credentials
post.description: This operation is Step 2 of the password reset flow. It is required to conduct Step 1 "Send a password recovery mail" in order to obtain the required credentials for this step.Resets a customer's password using credentials from a password recovery mail as a validation.

hash.description: Parameter from the link in the confirmation mail sent in Step 1

200.description: Returns a success response indicating a successful update.

post.description: This operation is Step 1 of the password reset flow. Make sure to implement Step 2 "Reset password with recovery credentials" in order to allow for the complete flow in your application. Sends a recovery mail containing a link with credentials that allows a customer to reset their password.

email.description: E-Mail address to identify the customer

storefrontUrl.description: URL of the storefront to use for the generated reset link. It has to be a domain that is configured in the sales channel domain settings.

200.description:
If email corresponds to an existing customer, a mail will be sent out to that customer containing a link assembled using the following schema:

Returns a success indicating a successful initialisation of the reset flow.

patch.summary: Change a customer's default shipping address
patch.description: Updates the default (preselected) shipping addresses of a customer.

parameters.name: addressId
parameters.description: Address ID

patch.summary: Change a customer's default billing address
patch.description: Updates the default (preselected) billing addresses of a customer.

parameters.name: addressId
parameters.description: Address ID

post.summary: Create a new address for a customer
post.description: Creates a new address for a customer.

post.summary: Generate JWT token for app system backend
post.description: Generate JWT token for authenticated communication with the app server

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the app

get.description:
Perform search to get category or product breadcrumb. 

Experimental API, not part of our backwards compatibility promise, thus this API can introduce breaking changes at any time.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: UUID for product or category

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type: category or product (optional - default: product)

parameters.name: referrerCategoryId
parameters.description: UUID for referrer category only used for product breadcrumb

200.description: Search result containing SeoUrl\'s to be used as breadcrumb.

post.description: Perform a filtered search for categories.

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

post.description: This endpoint returns information about the category, as well as a fully resolved (hydrated with mapping values) CMS page, if one is assigned to the category. You can pass slots which should be resolved exclusively.

parameters.name: sw-include-seo-urls
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to try and resolve SEO URLs for the given navigation item

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

parameters.name: navigationId
parameters.description: Identifier of the category to be fetched

parameters.name: slots
parameters.description: Resolves only the given slot identifiers. The identifiers have to be seperated by a '|' character

200.description: The loaded category with cms page

get.description: Used to fetch the current cart or for creating a new one.

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

delete.description: This route deletes the cart of the customer.

post.description:
This route adds items to the cart. An item can be a product or promotion for example. They are referenced by the `referencedId`-parameter.

Example: [Working with the cart - Guide](https://developer.shopware.com/docs/guides/integrations-api/store-api-guide/work-with-the-cart#adding-new-items-to-the-cart)

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

delete.description:
DEPRECATED: use removeLineItem instead. This route removes items from the cart and recalculates it.

Example: [Working with the cart - Guide](https://developer.shopware.com/docs/guides/integrations-api/store-api-guide/work-with-the-cart#deleting-items-in-the-cart)

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A list of product identifiers.

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

patch.description:
This route updates items in the cart. A typical example is updating the quantity of an item.

Example: [Working with the cart - Guide](https://developer.shopware.com/docs/guides/integrations-api/store-api-guide/work-with-the-cart#updating-items-in-the-cart)

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

post.description:
This route removes items from the cart and recalculates it.

Example: [Working with the cart - Guide](https://developer.shopware.com/docs/guides/integrations-api/store-api-guide/work-with-the-cart#deleting-items-in-the-cart)

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

post.summary: Create an order from a cart
post.description:
Creates a new order from the current cart and deletes the cart.

If you are using the [prepared payment flow](https://developer.shopware.com/docs/concepts/commerce/checkout-concept/payments#2.1-prepare-payment-optional), this endpoint also receives additional transaction details. The exact name of the parameters depends on the implementation of the corresponding *payment handler*.

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

requestBody.description: Contains additional metadata which is stored together with the order. It can also contain payment transaction details.

customerComment.description: Adds a comment from the customer to the order.

affiliateCode.description: The affiliate code can be used to track which referrer the customer came through. An example could be `Price-comparison-company-XY`.

campaignCode.description: The campaign code is used to track which action the customer came from. An example could be `Summer-Deals`

get.description: Call the checkout gateway, which is used to manipulate certain aspects of the checkout process (e.g. available payment methods).

post.summary: Fetch and resolve a CMS page
post.description:
Loads a content management page by its identifier and resolve the slot data. This could be media files, product listing and so on.

**Important notice**

The criteria passed with this route also affects the listing, if there is one within the cms page.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the CMS page to be resolved

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

slots.description: Resolves only the given slot identifiers. The identifiers have to be seperated by a `|` character.

post.description: Used for submitting contact forms. Be aware that there can be more required fields, depending on the system settings.

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

salutationId.description: Identifier of the salutation. Use `/api/salutation` endpoint to fetch possible values.

lastName.description: Lastname. This field may be required depending on the system settings.

phone.description: Phone. This field may be required depending on the system settings.

subject.description: The subject of the contact form.

comment.description: The message of the contact form

navigationId.description:
Identifier of the navigation page. Can be used to override the configuration.
Take a look at the settings of a category containing a concat form in the administration.

cmsPageType.description: Type of the content management page

post.summary: Add a product to a wishlist
post.description:
Adds a product to a customers wishlist.

    **Important constraints**

    * Anonymous (not logged-in) customers can not have wishlists.
    * The wishlist feature has to be activated.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: Identifier of the product to be added.

post.description:
Fetch a customer's wishlist. Products on the wishlist can be filtered using a criteria object.

    **Important constraints**

    * Anonymous (not logged-in) customers can not have wishlists.
    * The wishlist feature has to be activated.

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

post.summary: Create a wishlist for a customer
post.description:
Create a new wishlist for a logged in customer or extend the existing wishlist given a set of products.

    **Important constraints**

    * Anonymous (not logged-in) customers can not have wishlists.
    * A customer can only have a single wishlist.
    * The wishlist feature has to be activated.

delete.summary: Remove a product from a wishlist
delete.description:
Removes a product from a customer's wishlist.

    **Important constraints**

    * Anonymous (not logged-in) customers can not have wishlists.
    * The wishlist feature has to be activated.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: The identifier of the product to be removed from the wishlist.

200.description: Returns a success response indicating a successful removal.

404.description: The removal of the product failed. Probably because the product could not be found on the wishlist.

post.description: Returns blob file of a generated document to download.

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

200.description: Returns the document information and blob to download.

post.summary: Initiate a payment for an order
post.description:
This generic endpoint is should be called to initiate a payment flow after an order has been created. The details of the payment flow can differ depending on the payment integration and might require calling additional operations or the setup of webhooks.

The endpoint internally calls the payment handler of the payment method currently set for the order.

finishUrl.description: URL to which the client should be redirected after successful payment

errorUrl.description: URL to which the client should be redirected after erroneous payment

post.summary: Fetch a landing page with the resolved CMS page
post.description:
Loads a landing page by its identifier and resolves the CMS page.

**Important notice**

The criteria passed with this route also affects the listing, if there is one within the cms page.

parameters.name: landingPageId
parameters.description: Identifier of the landing page.

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

slots.description: Resolves only the given slot identifiers. The identifiers have to be seperated by a `|` character.

200.description: The loaded landing page with cms page

200.description: The loaded MediaCollection containing the requested Media Entities.

post.description:
This endpoint returns categories that can be used as a page navigation. You can either return them as a tree or as a flat list. You can also control the depth of the tree.

    Instead of passing uuids, you can also use one of the following aliases for the activeId and rootId parameters to get the respective navigations of your sales channel.

     * main-navigation
     * service-navigation
     * footer-navigation

parameters.name: sw-include-seo-urls
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to try and resolve SEO URLs for the given navigation item

parameters.name: sw-language-id
parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

parameters.name: activeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the active category in the navigation tree (if not used, just set to the same as rootId).

parameters.name: rootId
parameters.description: Identifier of the root category for your desired navigation tree. You can use it to fetch sub-trees of your navigation tree.

depth.description: Determines the depth of fetched navigation levels.

buildTree.description: Return the categories as a tree or as a flat list.

post.description: You have to use the hash from the link sent out via email to confirm the user registration.

hash.description: Hash parameter from link the in the confirmation mail

em.description: Email hash parameter from the link in the confirmation mail

post.summary: Create or remove a newsletter subscription
post.description:
This route is used to create/remove/confirm a newsletter subscription.

The `option` property controls what should happen:
* `direct`: The subscription is directly active and does not need a confirmation.
* `subscribe`: An email will be send to the provided email address containing a link to the /newsletter/confirm route.
The subscription is only successful, if the /newsletter/confirm route is called with the generated hashes.
* `unsubscribe`: The email address will be removed from the newsletter subscriptions.
* `confirmSubscribe`: Confirms the newsletter subscription for the provided email address.

email.description: Email address that will receive the confirmation and the newsletter.

storefrontUrl.description: Url of the storefront of the shop. This will be used for generating the link to the /newsletter/confirm inside the confirm email.

customFields.description: Custom field data that should be added to the subscription.

post.description: Removes a newsletter recipient from the mailing lists.

email.description: Email address that should be removed from the mailing lists.

text/calendar.example:
BEGIN:VCALENDAR
VERSION:2.0
PRODID:-//DIGITAL SALES ROOMS//Calendar//EN
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
METHOD:REQUEST
BEGIN:VTIMEZONE
TZID:UTC
BEGIN:STANDARD
DTSTART:20221016T102853Z
TZOFFSETFROM:+0000
TZOFFSETTO:+0000
END:STANDARD
END:VTIMEZONE
BEGIN:VEVENT
UID:95f79a4ecfae4794ae2b65b018330f88@shopware.com
DTSTAMP:20230713T102853Z
SUMMARY:test send invitation
DESCRIPTION:<font color=\"#d95959\">Hello</font>
LOCATION:https://localhost.test/presentation/95f79a4ecfae47
 94ae2b65b018330f88
STATUS:CANCELLED
TRANSP:TRANSPARENT
ORGANIZER;CN=Phung Nguyen:MAILTO:p.nguyen@localhost.com
ATTENDEE;CN=p.test;RSVP=TRUE;PARTSTAT=NEEDS-ACTION:MAILTO:p.test@test.
 com
DTSTART:20230713T121000Z
DTEND:20230713T123000Z
END:VEVENT
END:VCALENDAR
